abstract: White House Memo; Pres and Mrs Obama have shifted to more modern and abstract art for display in White House, exercising privilege of first families; when new administration arrives, White House curator’s office selects pieces to be displayed in building’s public and private spaces, but presidents and their families have full veto authority, and most have exercised it.
lead_paragraph: Works by Mark Rothko, Robert Rauschenberg and others are currently featured at the White House, among the 19th-century landscapes and portraits of past presidents.

headline.main: For Obamas, a More Abstract Choice of Art
headline.print_headline: For Obamas, a More Abstract Choice of Art

snippet: Works by Mark Rothko, Robert Rauschenberg and others are currently featured at the White House, among the 19th-century landscapes and portraits of past presidents.
